text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response states, \"Northern Ireland is effectively in both the UK and EU markets for goods. This means that goods can move freely between Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland (which is part of the EU) without checks at the border.\" This implicitly confirms that Northern Ireland acts as the border/interface between Great Britain (UK internal market) and the EU, which aligns with the criterion's intent regarding NI's unique position relative to the two markets.", "criterion_id": "4eee3ecc-1bad-41c1-9f80-035ef03d9ee9"}
